result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeramiha J. Sackman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and court costs paid out of cash bond.
DNA surcharge paid out of cash bond.
Letter of apology, submitted and approved by the victim/witness coordinator.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeramiha J. Sackman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jeramiha J. Sackman in court with attorney Allison E. Cogbill.  Kristi Sue Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement placed on the record.  State moved to amend charge to disorderly conduct pursuant to 947.01(1).  Granted.  Plea of no contest.  Plea colloquy.  Court found plea given freely, voluntarily, and intelligently; accepted plea; found DE guilty and ordered entry of JOC.  Brief statements by counsel.  Court ordered $100 fine with court costs; DNA surcharge; and letter of apology - already submitted and approved by the victim/witness coordinator.  Cash bond applied to fine and court costs.
to have contact with T.L.N. for purposes of child care and payment of bills
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
defendant's demand and motion for discovery evidence
Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no contact with T.N., except for purposes of child exchange through A.A. and D.R.

Defendant Jeramiha J. Sackman in court with attorney Allison Cogbill by phone.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waive reading of complaint and waive the time limits for a preliminary hearing. Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Jeramiha Sackman has waived time limits for a preliminary hearing.  Would like bond modified so that A.A. and D. R. be added for child exchange. So ordered by the court.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  - rt

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall have no contact with T.N., except for purposes of child exchange through a third party.

Attorney Kristi Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody.  Court finds probable cause for arrest without warrant based on the arrest header.  Attorney Tlusty requested a $2,000.00 cash bond; booking and no contact with T.N.  Defendant advised of right to an attorney.  Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond; booking; no contact with T.N. except for purposes of child exchange through a third party.  Next court date is August 26, 2014 at 1:00 p.m.  - rt
